column4: I was wondering if anyone would be able to assist me with recovering of a hdd, a friend told me to run a live cd but didnt explain much in the way of programs for recovering it
When the hard disk has phaysical errors, I'd advise making a clone copy of it first before mounting anything.

I'd do the following: Boot a live CD (ubuntu or even better: something like grml.org), run ddrescue to another device (external hd, for example), then try to mount any file systems on the image or run tools like testdisk to recover some files ...
Again, the device is shown by "fdisk -l"?
Replace <device> with the actual device name, without the <> brackets.
The same terminal you ran "fdisk -l" in. o_O
If blkid doesn't find anything then no valid file system (header) was found on the disk.
i think i failed at trying to run it >.>
is there a way to fix that?

I don't know whether there are tools that are able to restore file system (tables, headers or whatever). But I know that tools like testdisk and foremost will try to find anythink that looks like data files on the disk.
well my files are all there, now i need to figure out how to get them
is there a way to move the data off?
There must be a testdisk option to tell it where to save the restored files.
